title: Senior Simulation Software Engineer- Fort Leonard Wood, MO
job_description: Senior Simulation Software Engineer is expected to apply excellent team leadership techniques and industry standard (e.g., ISO 9001:2015, CMMI, applying High Level Architecture Waterfall, Spiral and Agile development methods) analysis and design techniques to design and develop complex software systems for trainers. Enhance corporate design capabilities and standards, while leading the software technical efforts of the engineering team. The position requires researching and applying advanced software architectures (e.g., run-time architectures, SAAS, S-1000D conversion, procedure automation, software development, automatic testing, ARINC 610C etc.), mathematical models, system modeling, graphical models and programming techniques to design, develop, maintain and extend innovative products and solutions for simulation and training.Job Summary: Support the US Army’s Modeling Simulation Battle Lab (MSBL) at Fort Leonard Wood MO by designing, developing, and testing subsystem for simulation and training systems.Important Information: DOD Secret Security Clearance is required for this role. US Citizenship Required.Position is 100% onsite at Ft Leonard Wood Essential Duties and Responsibilities:Works with minimal guidance to design and develop software subsystems, particularly critical software components using the project-dictated object-oriented languages, scripts, and libraries.Leads the technical software activities throughout the system development lifecyle, including design, development, peer reviews, testing, issue/defect resolution and documentation.Configures and manages the Simulation Environment.Develop or modify OneSAF behaviors and/or entities as needed, in order to properly execute the simulation that supports experimentation and monthly technical integration events.Execute simulation events in accordance with planning and the Model & Simulation Support Plan (M&SSP). Typically experiments run sequentially.Actively communicate with stakeholders, e.g. Project Engineer, Program manager, subordinate engineers.Train and assist the simulation interactors in performing their intended duties and resolving simulation issues.Requirements Job Requirements:At least one year of experience with Cloud Computing Environment (AWS/AZURE)Experience with DevOps and Cloud Platform as a Service (PaaS)Advanced knowledge of .NET/Core and SQL ServerKnowledge of: Microsoft IIS web servers, US ARMY OneSAF software, system/software accreditation, IA compliance, HLA, DIS, Security Technical Implementation Guides (STIGs)Must be willing to travel 10%Must have a minimum of 10 years of experience as a software engineerBS degree or equivalent professional certification desired in Computer Science or related field or equivalent years of experienceMust have secret clearance or ability to obtain a secret clearanceMust be familiar with security best practicesMust be a U.S. CitizenOther Important Need-to-Know Information: Pay is commensurate with relevant education and experience. ProActive Technologies is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. ProActive Technologies is an Affirmative Action Employer and a Drug-Free Workplace.  Employment offers are contingent upon satisfactory verification of criminal, education, driving, and/or employment background checks, as well as passing results from a pre-employment drug screening. ProActive Tech Compensation and Benefits include: Competitive Salary Flexible work schedule Group Health Insurance (including Medical, Dental and Vision coverage) Basic and Voluntary Life Insurance Short-Term Disability Insurance Long-Term Disability Insurance Employee Assistance Program Employee Stock Ownership Plan 401(k) Retirement Plan  Paid Holidays Paid Time Off (PTO)  Tuition Reimbursement Program Generous Referral Program Employee Discounts   At ProActive Technologies, we are a group of innovative and quality-driven engineers and professionals with a passion for helping our clients.  We provide state-of-the-art software and hardware design engineering, logistical and management support services in the simulation and training marketplaces for Government and private industry.  ProActive Technologies offers a competitive compensation package with comprehensive health, wellness, and retirement plans.  We are an employee-owned company where employees share in the success of their commitment to the company’s mission.  We are strongly committed to creating a diverse and inclusive environment where a variety of background, cultures, orientations, ideas, and talents can flourish.    For more information about ProActive Technologies, please visit www.proactivetechinc.com and follow us on Facebook and LinkedIn.

title: 12Y Geospatial Engineer
job_description: Job DescriptionJob DescriptionYou can play an important part in disaster relief missions as a Geospatial Engineer for the Army National Guard. In this role, you will extract and supply geographic data that supports military operations of all kinds and help commanders visualize the battlefield during combat.As a Geospatial Engineer, your primary responsibility will be to collect and process military geographic information from decentralized sources (remote sensed imagery, digital data, intelligence data, existing topographic products, and other collateral data sources), present this information to leaders, and return decisions to the field.You May Also Supervise topographic surveying, cartography, and photolithography activities Assist in topographic planning and control activities Assist in determining requirements and providing technical supervision of geographic intelligence programsJob Duties Create geographic data and compile them into maps Create and maintain multiple geospatial databases Prepare military-style briefs covering all aspects of the terrainSome Of The Skills You'll Learn Basic knowledge of Geographic Information Systems Imagery interpretation and exploitationHelpful Skills Interest in geography, maps, and charts Ability to demonstrate basic computer skills and work with drafting equipment Conceptualize ideas into computer-generated 2-D/3-D geospatial products Preference for a technical career fieldThrough your training, you will develop the skills and experience to enjoy a civilian career with construction, engineering, and architectural firms, as well as with government agencies as a surveyor, mapmaker, cartographer, cartographic technician, or photogrammetrist.Earn While You LearnInstead of paying to learn these skills, get paid to train. In the Army National Guard, you will learn these valuable job skills while earning a regular paycheck and qualifying for tuition assistance.Job training for a Geospatial Engineer requires 10 weeks of Basic Training, where you'll learn basic Soldiering skills, and 20 weeks of Advanced Individual Training (AIT) and on-the-job instruction, including practical application of geographic information systems. Part of this time is spent in the classroom and part in the field.Benefits/RequirementsBenefitsPaid trainingA monthly paycheckMontgomery GI BillFederal and State tuition assistanceRetirement benefits for part-time serviceLow-cost life insurance (up to $400,000 in coverage)401(k)-type savings planStudent Loan Repayment Program (up to $50,000, for existing loans)Health care benefits available VA home loansBonuses, if applicable Most non-prior service candidates will earn between $200 and $250 per drill weekend, subject to changeRequirementsMilitary enlistment in the Army National GuardMust be at least a junior in high school, or have a high school diploma or a GED certificateMust be between the ages of 17 and 35Must be able to pass a physical exam and meet legal and moral standardsMust meet citizenship requirements (see NATIONALGUARD.com for details)Requires military enlistment. Programs and benefits are subject to change. Ask your Army National Guard recruiter for the most up-to-date information. Actual MOS assignment may depend on MOS availability.Other Job InformationJob ID: 5015ZIP Code: 65301Job Category: EngineerAge Requirements: Must be between the ages of 17 and 35 administrator map reader aide
Industries: Transportation, Logistics, Supply Chain and Storage

title: Engineer IV -Threat Detection
job_description: Join a financial services firm where your contributions are valued. Edward Jones is a Fortune 500¹ company where people come first. With over 8 million clients and 19,000 financial advisors across the U.S. and Canada, we’re proud to be privately-owned, placing the focus on our clients rather than shareholder returns.Behind everything we do is our purpose: We partner for positive impact to improve the lives of our clients and colleagues, and together, better our communities and society. We are an innovative, flexible, and inclusive organization that attracts, develops, and inspires performance excellence and a sense of belonging.People are at the center of our partnership. Edward Jones associates are seen, heard, respected, and supported. This is what we believe makes us the best place to start or build your career.View our Purpose, Inclusion and Citizenship Report .1 Fortune 500, published June 2023, data as of December 2022. Compensation provided for using, not obtaining, the rating.Team OverviewThreat Management consists of detection engineers and cyber threat intelligence analysts whose mission is to provide actionable intelligence and utilize enhanced threat detection techniques to remediate coverage gaps and improve the security posture of the Firm. We sit under the CISO's security organization and are looking for a senior detection engineer to join our mostly remote team. The position is fully remote (within the US or Canada) and the Firm funds an annual trip to US headquarters to allow teams to bond in person and develop better rapport with local onsite teams.What You'll Do Lead by example in demonstrating, teaching, effectively communicating, and instilling industry best practices of detection engineering among your detection engineering team members.  Develop, maintain, and clearly document custom detection queries, data models, threat models, workflows, processes, and platform and attack technique research; review team member work for completeness and accuracy.  Onboard 3rd party security detections to increase the firm's coverage and partner with Red Team to validate existing detections and address findings.  Use structured workflows to prioritize detection engineering efforts.  Leverage your experience to identify opportunities for automation, metrics, new tooling, and general process and workflow improvements.  Analyze malicious code, scripts, attack techniques, or exploits to identify detection telemetry generated at a host and/or network level.  As needed, guide complex digital investigations promptly to fully understand and articulate activity.  Troubleshoot data/detection issues and collaborate with other teams to find resolution. What Experience You'll Need Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or Information Systems or related field preferred; or equivalent related work experience.  Minimum of 10 years of meaningful Information Systems Security experience, with at least 5 years in a SOC or working in Detection/Response during which you analyzed data from multiple log sources (e.g. firewall, IDS, proxy, authentication, endpoints, etc.) to identify trends, anomalies, and suspicious or malicious activity.  Experience with detections involving technologies such as cloud solutions, O365, and Kubernetes and advanced SIEM queries; bonus for KQL.  Experience with writing proof of concept code for attack techniques on Windows and Linux operating systems.  Ability to evaluate threat intelligence and collaborate with CTI analysts to identify detection opportunities.  Excellent written and verbal communication skills to describe security event details and technical analysis.  Expert threat detection knowledge and intuition, including a deep understanding of how adversaries move through a network, how that translates into detection opportunities, and the security issues and risks they pose.  Scripting experience in at least one language, preferably Python  Candidates that live within in a commutable distance from our Tempe, AZ and St. Louis, MO home office locations are expected to work in the office three days per week, with preference for Tuesday through Thursday. At Edward Jones, w e are building a place where everyone feels like they belong. We're proud of our associates' contributions to the firm and the recognitions we have received.Check out our U.S. awards and accolades: Insights & Information Blog Postings about Edward JonesCheck out our Canadian awards and accolades: Insights & Information Blog Postings about Edward JonesEdward Jones does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, gender, religion, national origin, age, disability, sexual orientation, pregnancy, veteran status, genetic information or any other basis prohibited by applicable law.At Edward Jones, we value and respect our associates and their contributions, and we recognize individual efforts through a rewards program that promotes a long-term career, financial security and well-being. Visit our career site to learn more about our total compensation approach, which in addition to base salary, typically includes benefits, bonuses and profit sharing. The salary range for this role is based on national data and actual pay is based on skills, experience, education, and other relevant factors for a potential new associate:Salary: $96471 - $164262Category: Headquarters

title: Security Engineer - System Integration/Engineering with Security Clearance
job_description: About the Organization Established in 2015, Assertive Professionals (A P), is an Economically Disadvantaged Woman Owned Small Business (EDWOSB) and Service-Disabled Veteran Owned Small Business (SDVOSB). Armed with expertise, a passion for the industry, and an employee centric corporate culture, A P has already made a name for itself within the Defense Contracting community taking 15th place in America's Top 100 Small Business Visionaries for the 2018 Best of Small Business Awards, receiving the HireVets Platinum Medallion from the Department of Labor in 2021, has a 4.9 rating on Glassdoor, made the Inc. 5000 list and is a VET100 awardee as one of the fastest growing Veteran Owned Businesses in 2021. Our Mission: Providing cleared professionals who assist the Department of Defense, Intelligence Community, and Department of Homeland Security in accomplishing their missions worldwide, through an employee centric culture of development, communication, and transparency. Position Timelines: OPEN positions are available right now. These are best for active job seekers. PROPOSED positions are pending the results of a source selection process. Have some flexibility and want to help us win? Apply to a proposed position today. PIPELINE positions are for anyone interested in a career with A P in the future. A recruiter will prequalify you and reach back out once we have a suitable position. Req Number AP--23-00020 Location St. Louis, Missouri Full-Time/Part-Time Full-Time Minimum Clearance TS/SCI Timeline Open Description Assertive Professionals is seeking a Security Engineer to support a National Security Customer in St. Louis, MO. This is a Funded and Open position with an annual $1,200 compliance bonus and a $1,000 sign-on bonus or up to $2,000 in reimburseable relocation expenses! Total annual compensation ranges from $140,000 - $150,000 and depends on meeting/exceeding desired requirements for the position. We offer an excellent benefits package, including PTO, 401k Match at 5%, Profit Sharing, Company paid Life Insurance, Dental, Vision, STD/LTD, and two options under a national medical plan with employee contribution. Duties may include:Act as the Security Engineer for the MGS effort within NGA/TIAT.Participate in registration meetings to formerly register all MGS related information systems with the Designated Approval Authority (DAA) for NGA.Ensure the System Security Authorization Agreement (SSAA) documents for each IS are properly prepared, maintained, and accurately reflects the definition, development, security testing processes, and relevant security requirements. Perform required actions to ensure all MGS related Information Systems are properly entered and maintained using the XACTA Information Assurance web application.Review all aspects of proposed system security plans to ensure the system is being developed in compliance with NGA security guidelines, agency policies, and Intelligence Community Directives.Ensure Vulnerability Assessment Testing (VAT) is scheduled and completed on an annual basis and any findings are addresses in a POAM.Ensure that appropriate Information Assurance Vulnerability Alerts (IAVA) are reviewed, assessed, and responded to in a timely manner.Maintain routine interface with the NGA C&A team (IAO, CE, and DAA) and keep them informed of any pending changes to the system baseline which may impact security.Review and provide input on security related test procedures prior to readiness reviews. Advises the Program Manager (PM) for life cycle integrated security engineering, to include review of Request for Change (RFCs), Engineering Change Proposals (ECPs), related C&A documents, attend design reviews, and ensure requirements are identified and documented.Provide support to the Program Manager to ensure that all aspects of each Information System (IS) from initial concept, through development, to implementation and system maintenance, and continuous monitoring meet applicable NGA C&A requirements.Provide advice and support to manage the IS throughout the life cycle including cost, schedule, and performance system development, and after initial operating capability (IOC) transitions the systems to operations.Provide advice and support to the PM during the early stages of the system life cycle to initiate the C&A process, negotiate the security requirements that must be met, and the technical security features of the IS.Responsible for ensuring that security guidance flows from the PM to the developer for satisfying the requirements to deliver the system, to include the schedule for delivering a certified and accredited system. Required Qualifications and Experience:TS/SCI with ability to pass CI Poly12 years of total work experience (11/Associates, 10/Bachelors, 9/Masters, 8/Doctorate)8 years of specialized experience (7/Associates, 6/Bachelors, 5/Masters, 4/Doctorate - For specialized experience, any academic degree substitution must match the career field of the required experience)8 years of demonstrated specialized experience in System Integration, System Engineering, Acquisition or Project Management experience.A Bachelor's Degree in System Engineering, Computer Science, a related technical degree, or equivalent experience (additional 8 years of specialized experience for a total of 16, if substituting degree. Desired Qualifications and Experience:Demonstrated understanding of the geospatial intelligence mission and its contributions to the IC.Demonstrated understanding of Certification and Accreditation processes. Demonstrated specialized experience with application with NGA systems architecture component & processes.Understanding of DoD's GEOINT Tasking, Processing, Exploitation and dissemination processes (TCPED).DAWIA Level III/II certification in Program Management or equivalent (i.e. PMP) or applicable experience.Demonstrated specialized experienced using the XACTA Information Assurance web application.Demonstrated specialized experience with NGA Continuity of Operations processes; experience with writing Information Technology Disaster Recovery (ITDR) plans, Business Continuity Plans, and modifying and documenting Essential Functions.Maintain a professional certification as a Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP).Click here to read more about how we protect your information EOE Statement Assertive Professionals, LLC, is an equal employment opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status or any other characteristic protected by law.

title: Lab Technician
job_description: The Lab Technician will set up and conduct performance testing to develop knowledge to continue Hussmann's leadership position in Refrigeration Systems, Merchandisers, and associated products and systems. Provide feedback to Engineering on design performance and suggest improvements based upon data. Conduct data analysis and prepare reports to document key knowledge learning. Build and change product configuration to support test setup and operations.Are you looking for a position in a temperature-controlled environment? Amazing benefits, available day one? A position that allows for work-life balance, no weekends/late nights/on call? This position is for you!Principal Responsibilities:Perform testing requiring conventional types of procedures and/or applicable industry standards.Set up Hussmann merchandisers for testing. This includes the installation of all refrigeration, electrical and data acquisition instrumentation connections.Conduct testing as directed by the Evaluation Engineer, Manager of Lab Testing or other Engineering personnel responsible for the project.Work within the R+D Lab team and assist other technicians as needed. Need to work well with others and transfer learning to the group effectively.Assist and conduct floor testing (structural, sound, transit, etc.) as assigned by Lab ManagerFollow safety protocols in place in the company.Computer skills in Word, Excel, Power Point, and skills necessary to learn the Hussmann data acquisition system and supporting programs for evaluation of data.Experience required:Lab Technician I: 0-2 years (recent graduates welcome)Lab Technician II: 2-5 yearsLab Technician III: 5+ yearsEducation Requirements and Qualifications:Technical Certificate in HVAC required.Technical Associates Degree preferred.Minimum of 1 year experience (new graduates welcome)Skills in use and operation of tools of the HVAC and refrigeration trade (brazing, electrical, etc.)EPA certification (universal) for refrigerant handling preferredAdditional Information:Will frequently work on projects or assignments in a team or group environment.Is responsible for developing good listening and communication skills.Prepares and presents reports as requested.Our organization offers benefits that are the best fit for you at every stage of your career:Comprehensive Insurance Plans: Health, Dental and Vision, 401k with Company Matching Contribution, Discretionary 401k Company Contribution, Tuition Reimbursement Program, Life/Disability Insurance, Family Leave, Panasonic Employee Discounts, Paid Vacation and Holidays, Wellness Program, Identity Protection, Community Stewardship, Employee Assistance Program and more.Hussmann is a subsidiary of Panasonic USA. Finding a better way has always been the Hussmann way. Since 1906, our focus on innovation has helped food retailers succeed. We hold over a 122 U.S. patents and 320 international patents from more than a dozen countries. We collaborate with customers across a variety of food retail segments as we work towards fulfilling a promise for better businesses, better partners, and a better world.Hussmann is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to veteran status, disability, age, race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, genetics, marital status, pregnancy, or any other non-merit based factor.
Industries: Manufacturing and Appliances, Electrical, and Electronics Manufacturing

title: Senior Software Test Engineer I with Security Clearance
job_description: Epsilon C5I (http://epsilonsystems.com/c5i) is seeking a Sr. Test Engineer with at least 6 years ofexperience for work in St Louis, MO. In this role, you will be part of a team providing development,integration, and sustainment of Geospatial Intelligence data management services in the Cloud, acrossmultiple security enclaves. Our engineers develop and integrate new services to manage anddisseminate mission data to authorized users. In this role you will be a lead to multiple test engineers wehave today, and will be able to create new processes to benefit our test process. If you have a passion for excellence in engineering and test initiatives and enjoy working on challengingprojects in a fast-paced, team-oriented environment where you get to create processes that benefitsour team directly – read on! Duties and Responsibilities: Responsible for software verification and validation, including test planning, development, execution, analysis and associated documentation Coordinate and organize testing efforts for multiple frontend web solutions across our team of knowledgeable systems and software engineers Support bug reporting and tracking and software test processes Assist in the development of the test strategy in order to meet release deadlines Adhere to established testing best practices using the latest build tools and testing frameworks Work under general supervision, and provide feedback on process improvements Define test strategies, plans, procedures and reports to benefit our customers Initiate and analyze bug reports and change requests Ensure that hardware/software deployed includes the functionality specified in all approved requirement documents and that it performs as expected from the customers perspective Required Qualifications: Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science; Information Science; Engineering, or related scientific or technical Discipline At least six (6+) years of experience in professional software testing Experienced with both Automation and Manual testing Experience with Automation Testing Tools, i.e. GitLab, Git Lab Runner, Jenkins, Selenium or similar Adept at diagnosing and debugging issues and creating clear reports on bugs when found Excellent written and verbal communication skills Familiar with Microsoft Office application (Word, Excel, and PowerPoint, Visio) Eligible to obtain a TS/SCI clearance Pursuant to the various government contractual requirements, all applicants must be U.S. Citizens. Desirable Qualifications: Knowledge of Government security policies and familiarity with security-related technologies and auditing tools. Familiarity with Operational deployments to Government Networks Knowledgeable on AWS services, i.e. EC2, S3 Experience with Build Tools and Version Control Systems, i.e. Gradle, Yarn, Git Familiarity with Java, Typescript, JavaScript, ReactJS, Apache Tomcat ADA Notations: Regular communication (hearing/speaking). Noise conditions range from very quiet to very noisy. Prolonged use of computer (typing/keyboarding). Frequently required to sit for long periods of time, standing, and walking. Ability to travel by car, air or other means of transportation, if required. Epsilon Systems Solutions, Inc. and its subsidiaries are proud to be Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employers, Minority/Female/Disabled/Veterans.

title: Software Systems Safety Engineer (Mid-Level, Senior or Lead) with Security Clearance
job_description: Job Description At Boeing, we innovate and collaborate to make the world a better place. From the seabed to outer space, you can contribute to work that matters with a company where diversity, equity and inclusion are shared values. We're committed to fostering an environment for every teammate that's welcoming, respectful and inclusive, with great opportunity for professional growth. Find your future with us. Boeing Defense Space and Security (BDS) is seeking motivated and dedicated Mid-Level, Senior or Lead Software System Safety Engineers (Levels 3, 4 or 5) to join our Phantom Works team in Berkeley, Missouri. The Phantom Works division applies sophisticated technologies to rapidly develop pre-production prototypes. We are looking for dedicated system engineers to join our team in developing the next generation of future franchise programs. The selected candidate will provide the technical guidance and perform critical system safety engineering work. The work will consist of planning, coordinating, and performing detailed System Safety tasks such as system and subsystem hazard analysis, fault tree analysis, and software safety analysis to mitigate potential product safety hazards. In addition to working with System Safety personnel, the individual will work extensively with design, development, and test personnel to impart safety requirements early in the design process. These tasks are accomplished within a collaborative environment with other program teams to assist with and/or plan design, develop, and verify lifecycle balanced system solutions including resolution of multi-functional technical issues. Position Responsibilities: * Apply an interdisciplinary, collaborative approach to plan, design, develop and verify a lifecycle balanced system of systems and system solutions * Evaluate customer and /operational needs to define and coordinate system performance, requirements, integrate technical parameters and assure compatibility of all physical, functional and program interfaces * Perform various analyses to optimize total system of systems and/or system architecture * Perform analyses for affordability, safety, reliability, maintainability, testability, human systems integration, survivability, vulnerability, susceptibility, system security, regulatory, certification, product assurance and other specialties quality factors into a preferred configuration to ensure mission success * Develop the planning, organization, implementation and monitoring of requirements management processes, tools, risk, issues, opportunity management and technology readiness assessment processes * Resolve multi-functional technical issues This position is expected to be 100% onsite. The selected candidate will be required to work onsite at one of the listed location options. This position requires the ability to obtain a U.S. Security Clearance for which the U.S. Government requires U.S. Citizenship. An interim and/or final U.S. Secret Clearance Post-Start is required. Basic Qualifications (Required Skills/Experience): * Bachelor, Master or Doctorate of Science degree from an accredited course of study, in Engineering or Computer Science Minimum of 5 years job experience as a software engineer Preferred Qualifications (Desired Skills/Experience): * 5+ years related work experience or an equivalent combination of education and experience 10+ years related work experience or an equivalent combination of education and experience Experience with software requirements, software design, documentation and configuration control Experience with software code development, and testing Experience programming C/C++ software for real time embedded systems Experience in System and Software Safety Typical Education & Experience: Experienced (Level 3) Education/experience typically acquired through advanced technical education from an accredited course of study in engineering, computer science, mathematics, physics or chemistry (e.g. Bachelor) and typically 5 or more years' related work experience or an equivalent combination of technical education and experience (e.g. PhD, Master+3 years' related work experience). In the USA, ABET accreditation is the preferred, although not required, accreditation standard. Senior (Level 4) Education/experience typically acquired through advanced technical education from an accredited course of study in engineering, computer science, mathematics, physics or chemistry (e.g. Bachelor) and typically 9 or more years' related work experience or an equivalent combination of technical education and experience (e.g. PhD+4 years' related work experience, Master+7 years' related work experience). In the USA, ABET accreditation is the preferred, although not required, accreditation standard. Lead (Level 5) Education/experience typically acquired through advanced technical education from an accredited course of study in engineering, computer science, mathematics, physics or chemistry (e.g. Bachelor) and typically 14 or more years' related work experience or an equivalent combination of technical education and experience (e.g. PhD+9 years' related work experience, Master+12 years' related work experience). In the USA, ABET accreditation is the preferred, although not required, accreditation standard. Relocation: This position offers relocation based on candidate eligibility. Drug Free Workplace: Boeing is a Drug Free Workplace where post offer applicants and employees are subject to testing for marijuana, cocaine, opioids, amphetamines, PCP, and alcohol when criteria is met as outlined in our policies. Shift Work: This position is for 1st shift At Boeing, we strive to deliver a Total Rewards package that will attract, engage and retain the top talent. Elements of the Total Rewards package include competitive base pay and variable compensation opportunities. The Boeing Company also provides eligible employees with an opportunity to enroll in a variety of benefit programs, generally including health insurance, flexible spending accounts, health savings accounts, retirement savings plans, life and disability insurance programs, and a number of programs that provide for both paid and unpaid time away from work. The specific programs and options available to any given employee may vary depending on eligibility factors such as geographic location, date of hire, and the applicability of collective bargaining agreements. Please note that the information shown below is a general guideline only. Pay is based upon candidate experience and qualifications, as well as market and business considerations. Summary pay range for experienced level 3: $97,750 - $132,250 Summary pay range for senior level 4: $119,850 - $162,150 Summary pay range for lead level 5: $147,050 - $198,950 This job posting will expire on 5/1/2024. #CASO Export Control Requirements: U.S. Government Export Control Status: This position must meet export control compliance requirements. To meet export control compliance requirements, a "U.S. Person" as defined by 22 C.F.R.120.15 is required. "U.S. Person" includes U.S. Citizen, lawful permanent resident, refugee, or asylee. Export Control Details: US based job, US Person required Equal Opportunity Employer: Boeing is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, physical or mental disability, genetic factors, military/veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

What Experience You'll Need Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or Information Systems or related field preferred; or equivalent related work experience.  Minimum of 10 years of meaningful Information Systems Security experience, with at least 5 years in a SOC or working in Detection/Response during which you analyzed data from multiple log sources (e.g. firewall, IDS, proxy, authentication, endpoints, etc.) to identify trends, anomalies, and suspicious or malicious activity.  Experience with detections involving technologies such as cloud solutions, O365, and Kubernetes and advanced SIEM queries; bonus for KQL.  Experience with writing proof of concept code for attack techniques on Windows and Linux operating systems.  Ability to evaluate threat intelligence and collaborate with CTI analysts to identify detection opportunities.  Excellent written and verbal communication skills to describe security event details and technical analysis.  Expert threat detection knowledge and intuition, including a deep understanding of how adversaries move through a network, how that translates into detection opportunities, and the security issues and risks they pose.  Scripting experience in at least one language, preferably Python  Candidates that live within in a commutable distance from our Tempe, AZ and St. Louis, MO home office locations are expected to work in the office three days per week, with preference for Tuesday through Thursday. At Edward Jones, w e are building a place where everyone feels like they belong. We're proud of our associates' contributions to the firm and the recognitions we have received.Check out our U.S. awards and accolades: Insights & Information Blog Postings about Edward JonesCheck out our Canadian awards and accolades: Insights & Information Blog Postings about Edward JonesEdward Jones does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, gender, religion, national origin, age, disability, sexual orientation, pregnancy, veteran status, genetic information or any other basis prohibited by applicable law.At Edward Jones, we value and respect our associates and their contributions, and we recognize individual efforts through a rewards program that promotes a long-term career, financial security and well-being. Visit our career site to learn more about our total compensation approach, which in addition to base salary, typically includes benefits, bonuses and profit sharing. title: Data Scientist (Mid)-Data & Analytics-IT-Corp
job_description: OverviewTekwissen group, is a workforce management provider throughout the USA and many other countries in the world. This client is a German multinational Pharmaceutical and biotechnology company and one of the largest pharmaceutical companies in the world, headquartered in Leverkusen, and areas of business include pharmaceuticals; consumer healthcare products, agricultural chemicals, seeds and biotechnology products.Job Title: Data Scientist (Mid)-Data & Analytics-IT-Corp Location: St Louis, MI 63146 Duration: 6 Months Job Type: Contract Work Type: Remote Job DescriptionWe're seeking a talented and innovative NLP/Information Retrieval Scientist to join our team. In this role, you will play a pivotal part in enhancing Large Language Models (LLMs) to provide more accurate, context-aware, and creatively curated responses with real-world applications. As an NLP/Information Retrieval Scientist, you will develop and to improve the usability and creativity of our LLM responses. You will collaborate closely with our multidisciplinary team of researchers and engineers to not only advance the technical aspects but also bring real-world relevance and creativity into our language models. The successful candidate will use the latest innovations in NLP and LLM to propose software solutions to improve customer experience. The NLP Data Scientist will design and test algorithms, conduct prototyping to evaluate possible scenarios leveraging computational and statistical techniques for the development of novel approaches for Text and Image Data. Required SkillsPh.D. (or MS with 4+ years of post MS experience), Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Physics, Mathematics, Statistics or an Analytics discipline. Plus 3 years of work experience Expertise with NLP or Information Proficiency in Python or in another high-level programming language Experience in developing statistical, and machine learning models for environmental and agronomical applications. Familiarity with LLM Experience analyzing and presenting complex data and proven problem-solving abilities. Strong publication record in leading scientific journals Strong background in NLP, Deep Learning and Python coding. Desired SkillsExperience working with agricultural/biological scientific data is highly desired. Drive for translating business problems into research initiatives that deliver business value. Creativity in defining challenging exploratory projects. TekWisen® Group is an equal opportunity employer supporting workforce diversity.

title: Cloud Network Engineer with Security Clearance
job_description: Overview: We are seeking a Cloud Network Engineer to: Support US Marine Corps (USMC) enterprise-level hybrid cloud data center engineering, operations and cybersecurity requirements Enable USMC world-wide customers to execute critical missions What you will do:As a Cloud Network Engineer you will enable capabilities for secure cloud infrastructure operations. You will engineer, design, plan, implement, operate and sustain the networking infrastructure to support hybrid-cloud operations including Software Defined Data Center operations, cloud integration, and fully native cloud environments. Your responsibilities ensure successful and secure operations of a multi-cloud on-prem and cloud-hosted enterprise capability supporting worldwide USMC customers. As a Cloud Network Engineer you will be responsible for Participating with the Networking and larger Infrastructure and Operations teams to enable networking capability for a hybrid-cloud environment Securing, operating, sustaining the on-prem and hybrid-cloud software defined data center using CISCO, F5, Palo Alto and VMWare’s NSX-T systems along with native cloud tools 24x7 including rotational on-call and after-hours patching requirements Designing, planning, engineering, implementing the network infrastructure for classified and unclassified networks including on-prem, hybrid-cloud and native cloud environments focused specifically on VMWare Cloud on AWS, AWS, and Azure Documenting networking infrastructure, data flows, security compliance, ports-and-protocols requirements to ensure design and operations capabilities Identifying future cloud networking capability requirements for consideration in engineering and design processes including evaluation of and recommendations for hardware, software, and new capabilities. Perform networking roles in Agile and traditional project teams to ensure successful implementation of secure networking operations Develop and implement management and monitoring capabilities to provide pro-active event identification to prevent incidents and outages Serving as Tier III Networking support responding to and remediating vulnerabilities, incidents, outages as needed including troubleshooting, after action review, or escalation and engagement with vendor Providing training and mentorship in areas of subject matter expertise to others on the team Maintaining networking documentation and security plans for networking infrastructure. Required Senior level experience engineering, implementing, operating, maintaining, securing CISCO and NSX-T infrastructure in Software Defined Data Center and/or cloud environments (AWS Azure preferred Experience with Proxy configurations, F5 GTM/LTM (APM/ AFM, ASM) and irules preferred Experience engineering, configuring maintaining, securing Palo Altos Experience with implementing networking configurations to support datacenter operations such as IIS, Apache, Encryption (FIPS), SSL Off-loading, DOD PKI, OCSP Senior-level experience configuring and operating networks in a STIG-compliant environment and documenting any required Plans of Action and Milestones Experience with proactive management and monitoring tools such as VMWare Aria (vRealize Operations) and VMWare Log Insight as well as networking systems-native management and monitoring tools Experience working with an enterprise ticketing system such as BMC Remedy Experience operating in ITIL and Agile/PMP frameworks IAT II Certification required. Possess an active DOD US Secret Clearance Preferred: CISCO Networking Certification, Cloud training or certification (Azure or AWS)

title: Mechanical Designer
company: Industrial Ally, A Salas O'Brien Company
job_description: Industrial Ally is currently looking for an experienced Mechanical Designer to join our growing team. Industrial Ally is a consulting Engineering and Design firm that specializes in heavy industrial projects. We use cutting edge technology, such as 3D scanning and modeling, to produce exceptional deliverables to our clients.Our office is conveniently located in Chesterfield, MO. We have an excellent client base and highly collaborative work environment. We offer a generous benefits package that promotes employee health, performance, and success. This includes health benefits starting the first of the month following hire and dental and vision benefits starting day one! In addition, we offer company paid Long Term Disability, Life insurance, an excellent 401k plan, paid time off, nine (9) paid holidays, a reliable bonus program, and opportunities to grow your career.TITLE: Mechanical Designer OVERVIEW: The Mechanical Designer provides expertise and support in a variety of areas including:a knowledgeable Mechanical Designer, adhering to company, department, and client drawing standards and procedures, and having a general understanding of required mechanical sizing calculations.procedures and collaborating to prepare design deliverables that meet project requirements under general supervision of the Mechanical Engineer.data from structural and electrical disciplines, as well as client and vendor information sources to prepare mechanical drawings.a variety of industrial projects with extensive, intermediate use of Revit.a working knowledge of mechanical materials, construction methods, and applicable building codes, including but not limited to ASME, Industrial Ventilation Guidelines, and CEMA Standards.REPORTS TO: Chief Mechanical EngineerSPECIFIC DUTIES: communicate and coordinate design work within the department, with other disciplines, and with external stakeholders such as clients and vendors.Act as Lead Mechanical on small projects; work with other designers and engineers as team member on larger projects.Participate in and contribute to project and interdepartmental meetings to facilitate successful completion of projects and to meet customer expectations and needs.Have awareness of project budgets and schedules.Understand and apply concerns of safety, maintenance, accessibility, constructability, and coordination.Learn use of current design software.Register point clouds.Produce typical project deliverables, given equipment cut sheets, such as individual drawings: Flowsheets General Arrangement Plans and Sections Chute Details Pipe Plans and Sections Piping Isometrics Vendor Request for Quote Drawings 3D Representations (isometrics, perspectives, photographs)Establish and utilize an appropriate level of detail between modeling and drafting for both conceptual and detailed engineering stages.Review and accurately incorporate information from mechanical and electrical equipment vendor drawings into final deliverables.Recognize and enter all mechanical information necessary to produce detailed drawings.Accurately size, locate, dimension, and tag mechanical members and components on drawings.Issue and record drawing submittals and revisions, and Requests for Information.Check your design and drafting for errors, omissions, and adherence to company standards. Understand layout requirements and routing criteria for mechanical chute, duct, and piping systems.Account for efficient equipment, piping, chute, and duct layouts and detailing that conform to industry practices.Possess working knowledge of equipment practices.Possess basic knowledge of structural design and equipment support practices.Continuously update and expand knowledge of the mechanical field as well as knowledge of client processes and facilities.QUALIFICATIONS:Associate Degree in Design Drafting or equivalent education and experience.5 years’ experience in mechanical design drafting with heavy industrial experience preferred.3 years’ experience producing mechanical models and construction documents from Revit, plus experience with AutoCAD and Office software preferred.communication skills with an understanding of teamwork and the requisite ability to coordinate work with internal and external project stakeholders.organization skills to effectively manage time and resources in the most efficient manner. The ability to multi-task on several projects and adapt to changing scope and deadlines. Diligent taking of notes during project discussions. Efficient and organized email communications.to maintaining the company’s professional image and reputation with timely, error free, accurate deliverables, which meet or exceed clients’ expectations.

title: Engineering Product Lifecycle Management, Process Engineer (Associate or Experienced)
job_description: Job DescriptionAt Boeing, we innovate and collaborate to make the world a better place. From the seabed to outer space, you can contribute to work that matters with a company where diversity, equity and inclusion are shared values. We’re committed to fostering an environment for every teammate that’s welcoming, respectful and inclusive, with great opportunity for professional growth. Find your future with us.The Boeing Defense, Space & Security (BDS) team is seeking is seeking an Engineering Product Lifecycle Management, Process Engineer located in Berkeley, MO.The Engineering Product Data Management (PDM) Core team has an opening for a Product Lifecycle Management (PLM) Process Engineer with Teamcenter (or equivalent PDM system) experience. This person will work with a team of PDM Engineers, Process engineers, Design Engineers and Manufacturing Engineers to support military aircraft and missile systems programs with their PDM systems. Our team provides process and tool support for the design and manufacturing engineers that use the PDM systems. We are also responsible for ensuring that the PDM systems meet current customer requirements and are updated as needed to support Boeing improvement initiatives. We have several major activities underway that involve working with these PDM systems and the engineering data housed within them.The primary assignment for this position is to provide process and tool support for the major programs at the Boeing – St. Louis site. This includes supporting Design and Manufacturing Engineers in performing their work using the Teamcenter PDM and associated applications.Position Responsibilities:Engaging with program engineers to resolve issues with their usage of Teamcenter and other applications related to engineering design and manufacturing processesSupporting engineering data delivery to suppliers and customers in specified formatsCoordinating with new programs at the St. Louis site to define configuration and data management requirements and configuring Teamcenter to support their needsWorking with Systems Engineering and program representatives to understand Model Based Engineering (MBE) requirements and implement them using existing PDM toolsWorking with cross-functional teams to understand customer and corporate requirements for digital data management and distribution and implement them using our existing PLM systemsAnother activity we are involved in is transitioning the programs at the Boeing-St. Louis site from their legacy PDM tools and process set to go-forward Digital Enterprise tools that support MBE and implement enterprise-level common processes. Assignments in support of this activity involve gaining expertise in the current engineering and production processes and tools and becoming a Subject Matter Expert (SME) in the go-forward PDM systems in order to support the end users. This includes having an in-depth understanding of the engineering design information and ensuring that the data is effectively migrated into the new systems.Typical activities include:Participation in the development of process and tool requirements for transitioning existing program activities to common digital enterprise systems and identification of gaps in both processes and toolsSupporting PDM system transition activities such as data migrations, data validation and system testingAnalysis of engineering data across applications to find issues and determine how to correct the data to ensure consistencyThis position is expected to be 100% onsite. The selected candidate will be required to work onsite at one of the listed location options. This position requires the ability to obtain a US Security Clearance for which the US Government requires US Citizenship as a condition of employment.An interim and/or final U.S. Secret Clearance Post-Start is required.Basic Qualifications (Required Skills/Experience):Bachelor of Science degree from an accredited course of study in engineering, engineering technology (includes manufacturing engineering technology), chemistry, physics, mathematics, data science, or computer science.5 + years of PDM system experience at both the user level and working directly with engineering data housed within the PDMExperience with a design tool (CAD package) like Siemens NX, CATIA, etc.?Experience with product design activities and/or product lifecycle managementExperience working with and/or coordinating across engineering disciplines to identify best practices and implement on multiple programs.Preferred Qualifications (Desired Skills/Experience):Experience with Siemens TeamcenterHave worked with data export techniques and data analyticsWorked with integrating other disciplines, such as manufacturing engineeringExperience with Siemens NXTypical Education/Experience: Level 3:Education/experience typically acquired through advanced technical education from an accredited course of study in engineering, computer science, mathematics, physics or chemistry (e.g. Bachelor) and typically 5 or more years' related work experience or an equivalent combination of technical education and experience (e.g. PhD, Master+3 years' related work experience). In the USA, ABET accreditation is the preferred, although not required, accreditation standard.Relocation:This position offers relocation based on candidate eligibility.Drug Free Workplace:Boeing is a Drug Free Workplace where post offer applicants and employees are subject to testing for marijuana, cocaine, opioids, amphetamines, PCP, and alcohol when criteria is met as outlined in our policies.Shift:This position is for 1st shift.At Boeing, we strive to deliver a Total Rewards package that will attract, engage and retain the top talent. Elements of the Total Rewards package include competitive base pay and variable compensation opportunities.The Boeing Company also provides eligible employees with an opportunity to enroll in a variety of benefit programs, generally including health insurance, flexible spending accounts, health savings accounts, retirement savings plans, life and disability insurance programs, and a number of programs that provide for both paid and unpaid time away from work.The specific programs and options available to any given employee may vary depending on eligibility factors such as geographic location, date of hire, and the applicability of collective bargaining agreements.Pay is based upon candidate experience and qualifications, as well as market and business considerations.Summary pay range:Level 3: $88,400 - $119,600Applications for this position will be accepted until May 17th, 2024Export Control Requirements: Not an export control positionEqual Opportunity Employer:Boeing is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Employment decisions are made without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, physical or mental disability, genetic factors, military/veteran status or other characteristics protected by law.

title: Network Delivery Engineer
job_description: About the role: As a Professional Services Delivery Network Engineer at Secure Data Technologies, you will have the opportunity to make an impact from day one, working with one of the region’s most innovative technology companies in an exponentially growing market. title: Simulations Hardware/Software Engineer with Security Clearance
job_description: Athenix Special Missions (ASM) is seeking a qualified Simulations Hardware/Software Engineer at the Mission Training Complex Capabilities Support (MTCCS)-Centers of Excellence (COE) Schools at Fort Leonard Wood, MO. ASM Quality Policy: To meet or exceed customers' expectation for quality, delivery, and service through continual improvement, striving to meet our objectives, and committing to meeting all legal and statutory requirements. Summary: Athenix Special Missions is seeking a qualified Simulations Hardware/Software Engineer to provide Mission Training Complex Capabilities Support II (MTCCS) technical and functional Constructive Simulation and Gaming support to TRADOC Centers of Excellence (COE) and Schools. This work provides technical and functional end-to-end (simulation to Mission Command Systems (MCS)) training functionality using TRADOC Proponent OfficeConstructive (TPO-C) low overhead simulations and TRADOC Proponent OfficeVirtual & Gaming (TPO-V&G) games. Simulations and tools such as Army Games for Training (GFT), Virtual Battle Space (VBS), and Division eXercise Training and Review System (DXTRS) are employed to enhance staff training at the lower continuum of training thresholds with the purpose of enhancing Military Decision Making Process (MDMP) and staff training in each respective TRADOC Institutions training curriculum. Specific duties may include, but are not limited to:Shall be available between 08001700 hrs, Monday through Friday except Federal holidays or when the government facility is closed for administrative reasons.Provide assistance and support with the necessary resources for planning, preparation, setup, operation, troubleshooting of the TPO-C, TPO-V&G, and MCS hardware and software applications and functionality to support the following tasks:Preparation, setup and operation of the closed networks supporting the TPO-C and TPO-V&G applications.Preparation, setup and operation of the unclassified simulation network backbone.Preparation, setup and operation of the classified simulation network backbone.Preparation, setup and operation of the DIS component between applications.Provide exercise preparation for TPO-C and TPO-V&G events.Provide exercise execution for TPO-C and TPO-V&G events.Provide unit database and scenario builds that includes planning, building, and loading, configuring and operating TPO-C and TPO-V&G applications/tools.MDMP preparation, setup and operation using TPO-C, TPO-V&G, and MCS ToolsProvide end to end functional preparation, setup and operations from the simulation/tool to include the MCS.Provide terrain preparation, setup and operation for TPO-C and TPO-V&G terrain tools.Provide TPO-C, TPO-V&G, and MCS troubleshooting expertise when technical and operational issues occur.When a TPO-C, TPO-V&G, and MCS issue/deficiency is identified, troubleshoot a work-around and submit a Problem Trouble Report (PTR) to TPO-C using the PTR Tool located on the NSC SharePoint Site.Provide support to all simulations in support of other exercises, training events, and planning.Provide support to LVC-G and other simulations, as requested.Serve as a systems and network administrator. This task includes all computer and network functions and infrastructure affecting the TPO-C, TPO-V&G, and MCS tools.Develop and provide written records (meetings, conference, working groups, after action reports, etc.) for each supported exercise/event.Provide testing and validation support to the capability and material development of the TPO-C tools.Provide operational and functional support of the MCS.Develop and provide briefing/presentation for each supported exercise/event as required by the OSCOR.Develop and provide Exercise Technical Summary Report for each supported exercise/event.When required, provide TPO-C and TPO-V&G support to other than COE/Schools.Provide computer networking support.Maintain training content; update the MilGaming web site and its content: graphics, animations, scenarios, models, terrain, training support packages (TSPs), and videos.Installation, Operation, and Maintenance of TPO-C and TPO-V&G Applications; this includes troubleshooting and resolving TPO-C and TPO-V&G software, hardware and network problem, real-time editing, and backup/recovery of all TPO-C and TPO-V&G data elements.Configuration Management; Maintain TPO-C and TPO-V&G applications. Manage version control and continuous integration, for all configuration management requirements.Install, Configure and operate existing and Emerging Army Stimulation-to- command and control (C2) interfaces; configure TPO-C and TPO-V&G hardware, software, and peripheral equipment to interface with Army Stimulation MCS interfaces as required.Administer the TPO-C and TPO-V&G systems during exercises and training events; participate in After Action Reviews (AARs) IAW TC 25-20, manage the TPO-C and TPO-V&G security compliance activities, to include the design and development of TPO-C and TPO-V&G information technology (IT) strategies at the local level.Maintains accountability of TPO-C and TPO-V&G furnished equipment; maintains accountability of TPO-C and TPO-V&G hardware, software, peripheral equipment, MCS equipment that may be issued by others and other simulation related items.Participate in required TPO-C and TPO-V&G /Mission Command Training Support Program (MCTSP) program review; participate in exercise readiness review, initial planning reviews, systems requirements reviews, software and hardware specification and design reviews, and participates in TPO-C and TPO-V&G user conferences/developer working groups.Instruct training audience and personnel to operate TPO-C, TPO-V&G, and MCS systems and tools. Required Qualifications:Bachelor's degree or experience equivalent in technical disciplines such as engineering, mathematics, statistics, and related computer sciences in performing capability development and Repair and Maintenance (RandM) tasks.Four years' experience in software development, simulation integration within the Microsoft Windows and Linux family of operating systems; to include expertise in hardware and software standards and protocols; ability to apply architectures to real world requirements using current Live, Virtual, Constructive and Gaming (LVC-G) platforms.Two years of experience in software testing, analysis, troubleshooting, problem trouble reports development, management and documentation (PTRs), and operating current gaming suite toolkit.Shall have the ability to write programs using C++, MFC, C#, Visual Basic, JAVA, XML, scripting languages, X programming and libraries and shall integrate networking packet protocols into simulation environments.Experience in providing technical advice for gaming development as it relates to the (LVC-G) Training Environment.Must be able to read, write, speak, and comprehend the English language.Bachelor's degree or equivalent, any discipline, and three (3) years' experience in operating simulations, simulators, models, games and MCS.In lieu of a college degree, four (4) years' experience in database management and/or systems management on systems within JLCCTC, GFT and MCS may be substituted for a bachelor's degree. Clearance: Requires a Secret clearance Location: National Simulation Center, Fort Leavenworth, KS / Fort Liberty, NC / JBSA, TX / Fort Novosel, AL / Fort Sill, OK / Fort Moore, GA / Fort Leonard Wood, MO / Fort Gordon, GA / Fort Gregg-Adams, VA / Fort Bliss, TX / Fort Jackson, SC / Fort Huachuca, AZ / Carlisle Barracks, PA / Charlottesville, VA / West Point, NY / Monterey Bay, CA Travel: Travel may be required MTCCS II_Simulations Hardware/Software Engineer_Questionnaire, 27 AUG 2023Do you possess a Secret security clearance? Please explain.Do you possess a bachelor's degree or experience equivalent in technical disciplines such as engineering, mathematics, statistics, and related computer sciences in performing capability development and Repair and Maintenance (RandM) tasks? title: Real Time Software Engineer with Security Clearance
job_description: Volt is immediately hiring for a Real Time Software Engineer in Saint Charles, MO Position Type: Full Time(Contract To Hire)Duration: 12+ MonthsLocation: Saint Charles, MO As a Software Engineer, you will: Opportunity to work directly with the operator interface to launch Harpoon missiles. Develop leadership skills and experiences. Contribute in all phases of the software development lifecycle. Develop software on both Windows and Linux platforms in both unclassified and classified environments. Create real-time operator-in-the-loop embedded systems, weapons systems, and weapon interfaces Apply knowledge and experiences with algorithms, human/machine interfaces, and launch protocols.. Use an agile process following a set of standard engineering processes. Develops, documents, and maintains architectures, requirements, algorithms, interfaces, and designs for software systems. Develops and maintains code and integrates software components into a fully functional software system. Develops software verification plans, test procedures, and test environments, executing the test procedures and documenting test results to ensure software system requirements are met. Performs software project management and software supplier management functions. Develops, selects, tailors, and deploys software processes, tools, and metrics. Executes and documents software research and development projects. Serves as a subject matter expert for software domains, system-specific issues, processes, and regulations. Tracks and evaluates software team and supplier performance to ensure product and process conformance to project plans and industry standards. Collaborate with several engineering teams to identify software products needed. Develop software verification plans and ensure software and system level testing is performed to verify correct software functionality. Perform software baseline audits to ensure products contain only the approved content. Coordinate with program Configuration Management to ensure appropriate release and distribution of software products. Maintain the Direct Attack Software team’s processes and command media. Contribute in an Agile development environment using Jira, BitBucket/git, and Confluence. Collaborate with a multi-discipline engineering team to create and implement Operational Flight Program software solutions. Contribute in all phases of the software development lifecycle in an Agile development environment.Test your software and assist system level testing to verify correct software functionality. Analyze problem reports and troubleshooting software defects. Develop leadership skills and experience. The ideal candidate will have:Required Qualifications: (Required Skills/ Experience) DOD Active Secret Clearance. Bachelor, Master or Doctorate of Science degree from an accredited course of study, in Computer Engineering, Software Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics or other technical degree. Minimum of 1 year of experience developing software. Minimum of 1 year of experience utilizing Linux and/or Windows operating systems. Experience in embedded real-time software development. Preferred Qualifications: (Desired Skills/Experience) Experience with weapon and/or aircraft interfaces Professional experience with Visual Studio, JIRA, Green Hills AdaMULTI, VxWorks, and/or Ada Previous role that used a software development process. Experience with ClearCase and ClearQuest. Experience with Jenkins. Experience programming in Ada. Experience with Python, or C#. Experience with C or C++. Experience with Git or a similar version control system. Experience working in an Agile software development environment. Experience working in a team environment in a professional environment.
